item.title: The innards of pisoc.net
item.description: TL;DR Our flask app listens for webhooks triggered by pushes to the repository. When it recieves a POST request to the “webhook endpoint”, it pulls the latest versions of the repositories for the website (main and theme submodule) and uses Hugo to rebuild the static portion of the site. In some more detail Python and Flask Flask is a web development “microframework” written in Python. We’re using this as the “bridge” between the two functionalities we need for this project: serving web content, and executing commands on the host machine.
